lines.text: Pitcher's got a big butt! Pitcher's got a big butt!

[after Henry throws a ball from the bleachers to home plate]
I just figured out why the Cubs lose every year. They've got more talent in the stands than they do in the field.
[after Chet Steadman gives up a home run]
Well, that's going to bring Rocket's earned run average to about, uh, three hundred or so. Which equals the attendance here today. What a team.
Hey, your mom has a pretty good arm! I ain't seen the floater pitch since Scuffy McGee!
readiness, recuperation, and conditioning!
[once taken out of the cast, Henry's arm snaps around and hits Dr. Kersten in the nose]

[muffled, with hands over his face]
Funky, buttloving...!
Did he say "funky buttloving?"
Henry, don't take this serious. But its nothing to joke about. But one day, your gift will be gone.
[first lines]
Opening Day at Wrigley, and oh what a sight! The diamond, the decorations, and the dread of yet another losing season.
Don't call me "Rocket".
Why not?
'Cause I'm not the "Rocket" anymore.
Yeah, I don't get it, you're throwing so slow.
Well, thank you very much.
BRICKMAN!

[Talking softly]
I'll be right back!
I'm looking for Henry Rulenfurter.
Henry Rowengartner?
Yeah.
I'm Henry!

[*confused, apparently because he had no idea Henry was a kid*]
... I might be looking for your father.
Carrie, Harold told me that Becky Fraker doesn't think you're very ugly.
Oh, my god... It's Billy Frick!
You good for another inning?
You betcha, Sally baby!
Good, 'cause you're on deck.

[dumbfounded]
Huh?
You're up after Fern.
You can't let him bat.
He's gotta learn sometime.
This one's for MOMMY, MOMMY, MOMMY!
[Mary Waving]
HONEY!
Reporters are foaming at the mouth for a piece of the kid.
Which piece?
The only reason you are playing for the Cubs is because you broke your stupid arm!
I wrap the cake up in my vomit bag, and voila!... Breakfast!
[pounding the airplane tray table]
Conservation, Managing resources... that is the key to Baseball.

[Sal finally gets Henry's last name right during the Divison Championship game, after Chet Steadman steps off]
Rowengartner, you're going in.

[confused]
What did he just call me?
[Chet laughs]
Hey, kid! How'd you like to play for the Chicago Cubs?
Great! But I gotta ask my mom first.

[Henry is playing a GameBoy]
That's going to make you stupid.
[he doesn't reply]
Maybe it already has.
Wow, you ate that whole thing?
Why, sure! It wasn't that much
That's impressive.
You should see what I can do in a bed!
Do me a favor, Henry. Don't take this game too seriously.
Why not?
Because one day it'll all be over. Your gift will be gone.
Way to go, Runamucker!
Punctuality, Henry. Without it, time stands still.
Sometimes you just gotta put the pedal to the metal and live the fantasy! Rock and roll!
Sweet meat pies! Rowengartner's going to bat!
Hey! We want a pitcher, not an underwear snitcher!
[after Henry accidentally throws a fielded ball over the outfield fence]
Is that play legal?
They're sending Henry in!
Yeah, we're gonna go sit closer so you can see better.
Come on, let's go get seats.
Seats? You mean down on the field level?
Yeah.
No, no, no. Please, that's too dangerous.
Why?
Me, the owner of the Cubs sitting down with the fans? They'd kill me.
[repeated lines, while Henry is at bat]

[watching on TV]
Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

[watching from the dugout]
Oh, my God. Oh, my God.

[in the batter's box]
Oh, my God. Oh, my God.
Hi, Chet, I'm Henry's ma!
Hi, Henry's mom!
You big ugly piece of shit!
Mr. Carson's last year as team owner, he must be really depressed.
Oh boy, Fish, look a decoder ring... I got it out of the Cracker Jack box... look it fits on your finger.
Yeah, yeah, that's great, Uncle Bob.
[Whispers to assistant]
That man is turning into a cracker jack.
You're the best thing to happen to baseball since Cracker Jack!
Let's go back to our dull lives and search for meaning.
